page.title: 20A WALK IN THE COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: The dog and I set off for a walk along the old railway line which is overgrown with weeds. We go across one grass field which has just been cut and baled. The grass in another field is being taken off as turf and will be ploughed and sown with corn. In another meadow there are some cows. Wild flowers are abundant - buttercups, daisies and clover. A short way on we see a huge machine, we've come across the new oil pipeline. The machine is digging out the trench ready for the pipes which are laid end to end and welded together. Further on we see a boy fishing on the banks of the River Isbourne. The traffic on the A435 Evesham to Cheltenham road seems far away although it is quite close.
